definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: When Abraham's servant heard what they said, he bowed down to the ground before the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕的仆人听见他们这话，就向耶和华俯伏在地。

sentences.english: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
sentences.chinese: 彼得一进去，哥尼流就迎接他，俯伏在他脚前拜他。

sentences.english: When all the people saw this, they fell prostrate and cried, 'The Lord -he is God!
sentences.chinese: 众民看见了，就俯伏在地，说，耶和华是神。

sentences.english: Seeing this, Manoah and his wife fell with their faces to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 玛挪亚和他的妻看见，就俯伏于地。

sentences.english: And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth, that he should be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.
sentences.chinese: 凡不俯伏敬拜的，必扔在烈火的窑中。

sentences.english: And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.
sentences.chinese: 凡不俯伏敬拜的，必立时扔在烈火的窑中。

sentences.english: An enemy who lies at your feet begging forgiveness must not feel your sword.
sentences.chinese: 对俯伏在你脚下乞怜的敌人，绝不可使他触及你的剑。

sentences.english: 25As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet in reverence.
sentences.chinese: 彼得一进去，哥尼流就迎接他，俯伏在他脚前拜他。

sentences.english: I put my forehead down to the damp, seaweed-smelling sand.
sentences.chinese: 我将前额俯伏在潮湿的沙滩，海藻腥涩。

sentences.english: And when all the people saw it, they shouted for joy and fell facedown.
sentences.chinese: 众民一见，就都欢呼，俯伏在地。

sentences.english: An enemy who lies at thy feet begging forgiveness must not feel thy sword.
sentences.chinese: 对俯伏在你脚下乞怜的敌人，绝不可让他触及你的剑。

sentences.english: All his subjects had to bow before it.
sentences.chinese: 所有他的臣民都要在金像前俯伏敬拜。

sentences.english: And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, [bowing himself] to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕的仆人听见他们这话，就向耶和华俯伏在地。

sentences.english: Finally, a single ray of light shot from out and fell full upon the vulture eye.
sentences.chinese: 最后，一个单一的光芒从俯伏充分的秃鹰眼。

sentences.english: Peter fell on his face at Jesus' feet and said.
sentences.chinese: 彼得俯伏在耶稣膝前，说。

sentences.english: O come let us worship and fall down before Christ our King and our God.
sentences.chinese: 前来，让我们敬拜俯伏于上帝基督，我们的君王。

definition: to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
